required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A 6-Week, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Potential of FMX-101, 4% And Vehicle to Induce a Photo Allergic Skin Reaction in Healthy Volunteers, Using a Controlled Photo Patch Test Design

brief_summary.textblock: A 6-Week, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Potential of FMX-101, 4% And Vehicle to Induce a Photo Allergic Skin Reaction in Healthy Volunteers, Using a Controlled Photo Patch Test Design

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of photoallergic skin reactions (numerical equivalent scoring of erythema and edema) after periodic exposure to IP on irradiated and non-irradiated skin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male or female who were 18 years of age or older
- Had uniformly-colored skin on the lower thoracic area of the back which allowed discernment of erythema, and were Fitzpatrick Skin Types I, II or III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had any visible skin disease at the application site which, in the opinion of the investigative personnel, would have interfered with the evaluation of the test site reaction
- Had damaged skin in or around the test sites, including sunburn, excessively deep tans, uneven skin tones, tattoos, scars, excessive hair, numerous freckles or other disfigurations of the test site
